summary.description: The PI-CAI challenge is to validate modern AI algorithms at clinically significant prostate cancer (csPCa) detection and diagnosis. This model algorithm provides the baseline for the challenge.

outputs.label: Prostate cancer probability
outputs.description: Case-level likelihood of harboring clinically significant prostate cancer, in range [0,1]

outputs.label: Transverse cancer detection map
outputs.description: Detection map of clinically significant prostate cancer lesions in 3D, where each voxel represents a floating point in range [0,1]

details.name: PI-CAI challenge baseline
details.devteam: Diagnostic Image Analysis Group, Radboud University Medical Center, Nijmegen, The Netherlands

use.title: Intended use
use.text: Prediction of the likelihood of harboring clinically significant prostate cancer (csPCa) in prostate biparametric MRI exams.

analyses.title: Evaluation
analyses.text: Patient-level diagnosis performance is evaluated using the Area Under Receiver Operating Characteristic (AUROC) metric. Lesion-level detection performance is evaluated using the Average Precision (AP) metric. Overall score used to rank each AI algorithm is the average of both task-specific metrics: Overall Ranking Score = (AP + AUROC) / 2

evaluation.title: Evaluation data
evaluation.text: The test sets are two private cohorts of 100 and 1000 biparametric MRI exams respectively. The first was used to tune the algorithms in a public leaderboard, the second was used to determine the top 5 AI algorithms.

training.title: Training data
training.text: For the PI-CAI a publicly available training datasets of 1500 biparametric MRI exams including 328 cases from the ProstateX challenge were made available.

references.label: PI-CAI publicly available training data annotations

limitations.title: Limitations
limitations.text: This algorithm was developed for research purposes only.
